titlestmt.titleproper: Frank Jasek papers, Inclusive: 1915-2012, undated, Bulk: 1939-2012, undated

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The Frank Jasek papers contain research filesDLconsisting mostly of notes, correspondence, photographs, compact discs, and literary productionsDLused in the publication of Soldiers of the Wooden Cross: Military Memorials of Baylor University.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Frank Jasek, born in 1947, authored the book Soldiers of the Wooden Cross: Military Memorials of Baylor University. He graduated from Southeastern University in 1969 with an aviation degree, and from Baylor University with a business administration degree in 1973. He married Janet Jasek in 1978. Frank Jasek worked at Moody Memorial Library at Baylor University starting in 1996.

After eleven years of research, he self-published Soldiers of the Wooden Cross: Military Memorials of Baylor University in 2012. The project involved writing about Baylor alumni who died as a member of the military forces of the United States. Each deceased alumni is represented on Baylor campus by a granite lamppost, with their name inscribed on a plaque attached to the lamppost. Their stories are preserved in the book, along with photographs of them as available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Frank Jasek papers begin in 1915 and end in 2012. The largest series in the collection is the Soldiers of the Wooden Cross, Baylor University Memorial Lamppost Plaques series, which contains Jasek’s subject files used in compiling the majority of his book. The only other series in the collectionDLSoldiers of the Wooden Cross, Research FilesDLconsists of various supplementary items also used in completing the volume.

The Frank Jasek papers contain many of the subject and research files used by Jasek in writing and compiling his edited volume of short biographies, Soldiers of the Wooden Cross: Military Memorials of Baylor University. This book identifies and outlines the lives of Baylor men and women who died while serving in the armed forces. These individuals have been memorialized on the campus of Baylor University through the erection of lampposts with shield-shaped plaques bearing their names. The first eighty-four lampposts were built in 1946, with at least sixty more that have been added since.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: When the collection was donated, most of the files were organized alphabetically by folder title. The few that were out of sequence have been placed in their proper order to reflect an alphabetical arrangement. Since the folders already had titles when the collection was donated, existing folder titles have been preserved. When the spelling of names from folder titles did not match names that appeared in Soldiers of the Wooden Cross, the spelling used in the book has been provided in brackets as part of the folder title.
An inventory was created shortly after the collection was donated but prior to the creation of this finding aid.
The collection is currently organized into two series: I. Soldiers of the Wooden Cross, Baylor University Memorial Lamppost Plaques, II. Soldiers of the Wooden Cross, Research Files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frank Jasek Papers, Accession #3932, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Brady Winslow. Released on 2013-11-15.
